movies.title: Currito de la Cruz
movies.plot: Having been a poor orphan who grew up in the hospice, the dream of Currito de la Cruz is to become a bullfighter. When he finally gets the chance of fighting for the first time, it will be in the presence of Manuel Carmona, a renowned bullfighter who will become his protector. In addition he falls in love for the daughter of Carmona and, although Currito gets to be famous, he is apparently unrequited.
movies.simplePlot: A poor honest boy finds patronage by a veteran to become a torero (bullfighter). After his raise and fall he will learn to overcome difficulties. Corridas, tientas and other bullfight related traditions are shown. Played by a real torero.

biography.bio: Pepín Martín Vázquez was born on August 6, 1927 in Sevilla, Andalucía, Spain as José Martín-Vázquez Bazán. He was an actor, known for Currito de la Cruz (1949) and Castles in Spain (1954). He died on February 27, 2011 in Sevilla.
biography.name: Pepín Martín Vázquez

biography.bio: He was a Spanish actor; his father was from Puerto Rico and his mother from Catalonia. His debut in theater was in 1943 and in cinema in 1944. At the end of the fifties he lived in South America. He committed suicide with a gunshot while living in Mexico City, Mexico.
biography.name: Jorge Mistral

biography.bio: Manuel Luna was born on April 27, 1898 in Sevilla, Andalucía, Spain as Manuel Luna Baños. He was an actor, known for El crimen de la calle de Bordadores (1946), Abel Sánchez (1947) and La nao capitana (1947). He was married to Cándida Mena. He died on June 9, 1958 in Madrid, Spain.
biography.name: Manuel Luna

biography.bio: Spanish actress born in Madrid on 13 December 1923, into the bosom of a poor family. Her mother was the one who inculcated her artistic gifts. She entered the Conservatory, where she studied singing and music. Still being an adolescent, she entered a children's company performing shows for children at the 'Teatro Español de la Plaza de Santa Ana' in Madrid. This way, she was hired several times to act in groups or with little roles in the classic theatre plays offered by Cayetano Luca de Tena, who was the director of the theatre at that time. She had her first chance with a part at Shakespeare's 'A Midsummer Night's Dream'. In 1944 she won a radio song contest, and then she was hired, together with Tony Leblanc, by the company owned by Lola Flores and Manolo Caracol, to play as secondary stars or 'Vedettes Americaines'. That was the starting point of her popularity. Her first works were in the cinema (Oro y marfil (1947), La muralla feliz (1947), Currito de la Cruz (1949), Servicio en la mar (1951)), but her best facet is theatre. She has a wide repertoire, including musical plays ('El hombre de la Mancha' [Man of La Mancha], 'La Perrichola', 'La corte del Faraón') and dramatic plays ('Fortunata y Jacinta', 'María Reyes', 'La zapatera prodigiosa', 'Anillos para una dama', among others). In 1997 she won a National Theatre Award.
biography.name: Nati Mistral

biography.bio: This actor started learning singing and dancing. Then he had very different occupations, including boxing, and even become to be the light weight amateur champion of Castilla, Spain. Later he entered the theatre, acting in the companies of Nati Mistral and and Celia Gámez. His entry in cinema was with little and secondary roles (Los últimos de Filipinas (1945) was his first film), many of them as what in spanish is said to be the 'chulo madrileño' (the typical classic Madrid city man, with his genuine verbal accent and special behaviour). With this type of roles he got great success in the 50's. Once he had become a known actor, he started his career as director and producer. He created his own production company and produced three films, but had no success at all with it and the company went to bankrupt. Finally, he decided to continue as an actor. In 1993 he was paid reverence in the Goya Awards Ceremony for his whole career.
biography.name: Tony Leblanc

biography.bio: Juan Espantaleón was born on March 12, 1885 in Seville, Spain as Juan Espantaleón Torres. He was an actor and writer, known for The Prodigal Woman (1946), The Nail (1944) and El fantasma y Dª Juanita (1945). He was married to María Victorero. He died on November 26, 1966 in Madrid, Spain.
biography.name: Juan Espantaleón

biography.bio: Félix Fernández was born on July 21, 1899 in Cangas de Onís, Oviedo, Spain as Félix Fernández García. He was an actor, known for Welcome Mr. Marshall! (1953), The Rocket from Calabuch (1956) and ¿Crimen imposible? (1954). He was married to Irene Guerrero de Luna. He died on July 9, 1966 in Madrid, Madrid, Spain.
biography.name: Félix Fernández

biography.bio: Descended from a family of actors, debuted in the theater at age 8 with "The Lark and the Kite" which will run for three years all over Spain. Later works Pedro Zorrilla Companies, Mary Major and Ricardo Calvo. From 1928 until 1948, formed his own company together with her husband. It was in 1948 when it is integrated at the Teatro Lara in Madrid as a leading lady, staying until 1961.
biography.name: Amparo Martí

biography.bio: Francisco Bernal was born on July 22, 1900 in Jumilla, Murcia, Spain as Francisco Bernal Jiménez. He was an actor, known for The Rocket from Calabuch (1956), Marcelin, pain et vin (1955) and Déracinés (1951). He died in 1963.
biography.name: Francisco Bernal

biography.bio: Eloísa Muro is an actress, known for La vida en un hilo (1945), Rumbo (1950) and Oscuros sueños de agosto (1968).
biography.name: Eloísa Muro

biography.bio: Arturo Marín was born on September 26, 1894 in Badajoz, Spain. He was an actor and writer, known for El crimen de Pepe Conde (1946), Comiques (1954) and I Was a Parish Priest (1953). He died on March 13, 1954 in Spain.
biography.name: Arturo Marín

biography.bio: Rosario Royo is an actress, known for Fray Escoba (1961), Nada (1947) and Isidro el labrador (1964).
biography.name: Rosario Royo

biography.bio: Manuel Requena was born on August 21, 1891 in Alicante, Spain as Manuel Requna Mendoza. He was an actor and writer, known for Confidential Report (1955), Carnival Sunday (1945) and La niña de la venta (1951). He died on May 9, 1969 in Madrid, Spain.
biography.name: Manuel Requena

biography.bio: María Isbert was born on April 21, 1917 in Madrid, Spain as María Vicenta Ysbert Soriano. She was an actress, known for Viridiana (1961), Le bourreau (1963) and Mortadel et Filemon (2003). She was married to Antonio Spitzer. She died on April 25, 2011 in Villarrobledo, Albacete, Castilla-La Mancha, Spain.
biography.name: María Isbert

biography.birthName: José María Prada de la Vega
biography.bio: José Prada was born on November 15, 1891 in Toledo, Castilla-La Mancha, Spain as José María Prada de la Vega. He was an actor, known for La vengeance (1958), Déracinés (1951) and Death of a Cyclist (1955). He died on August 19, 1983 in Madrid, Spain.
biography.name: José Prada

titlesAwards.titleAwardOutcome: Won Prize of the National Syndicate of Spectacle
